column4: I have a .iso of a GNU/Linux distro downloaded, but no blank CD-Rs, only CD-RWs is there a way I can still install the new distro? (i'm on ubuntu right now)
oh. i also just reread what you said. you can install from CD-RW
but the cd is detected and starts to boot?
what distro and arch is that?
id try rewriting the image to another cd before i did anything else
when/if that doesnt work, i'd copy the contents onto a partition that wont be overwritten during your install
then you need a working live cd
alright, thanks, I'll try burning it again now.....
also, take a look at debootstrap
this is why you must always repeat your question in its entirety, and not pieces :)
